chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bronte T McKinney

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Bronte McKinney - #2022004703, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Bronte T McKinney in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Bronte T McKinney.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense request a plea date.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Bronte T McKinney in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Bronte T McKinney in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Discovery received.  State has submitted an additional 10 pages of discovery of which counsel request an adjournment to review with client.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, defendant Bronte T McKinney not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant is not produced, appearance is waived. State is in compliance with victim/witness laws. Defense is still in negotiations and requests a status date. State has no objection. Court grants defense's requests and adjourns matter for a status.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, defendant Bronte T McKinney not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Court finds state has complied with victim notification.  Parties request an adjourned scheduling conference.  Court granted request.  Case remains calendared in Br 15.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Bronte T McKinney in court with attorney Angel L Johnson appear by video.  Defendant Bronte T McKinney in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Remain under oath for the state: Detective Braunreiter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bronte T McKinney in court by video with Attorney Angel L Johnson who appears in person.  Defendant Bronte T McKinney in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Stipulation to 16JV780 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Braunreiter. Due to the latness of the hour, this matter is adjourned for a continued preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with I.M.
Chambers Food Mart, 200 E. Chambers
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Bronte T McKinney in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Bronte T McKinney in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bronte T McKinney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
